page.title: 16Mannington Farmers Day
page.content: {THE FARMER'S DAY { }The farm owner, Mr Dacombe wakes up at about 5.00am,at 5.30am he feeds the cats and the calves.The milking starts at 6.00am and goes on until about 8.30am,then he has breakfast. At 9.00am he starts the farm accounts, then has some finishing off jobs for example cleaning out the milking parlour,cleaning out the calf pens. He also has maintainance and repairs to do on buildings, fences and farm machinery. Then comes the afternoon the farmer checks electric fences, many fields are strip grazed. In the haymaking season the farmer would be busy in the fields, otherwisehe may be involved in horticultural jobs. At one time vegetables were grown.At 3.30pm milking commences again. 9.30pm BED.
